comments:
Hi

 There are two test cases namely testFileNoSiteXMLSite & 
testFilePackageExecutableFeatureSite under 
org.eclipse.update.tests.regularInstall. Both of these test cases are failing 
in HP-UX on PA_RISC.

The exception is "plugin not installed locally".

Should we write some PA_RISC specific so as to pass these two test cases. 

The same is with testSpaceInURL & testSpaceInHTTPURL test cases. 
Other corollary test cases like testFileSite, testHTTPSite & testInstall in 
TestInstall.java is passing. 



Thanks & Regards
Balasubramaniyan K

can you provide more details about how you test? 
what the error is/trace/log ?
jdk used?

First the automated test cases was run. These test cases failed. 

Next, we ran these test cases individually from within Eclipse using Run->Junit 
Test Plug-in.

Have you looked at those features/plugins? They may have some environment 
variables (os/nl/arch/ws) that may not apply to your own operating 
environment, so tests may fail. In that case, it is rather a problem with the 
tests themselves than with the actual update code.

Created an attachment (id=14549)
Data & Webserver folder patches for org.eclipse.update.tests.core

Dorian Birsan suggested to check the environment variables (os/nl/arch/ws). 
Thanks Dorian. Your suggestion worked.

These tests cases had feature.xml which had a mention for type of OS. More 
specifically OS variable was defined as "Win32, LINUX".

When we added HP-UX to these OS variables as "Win32,LINUX,HP-UX" , the 
following test cases passed successfully:
A) testFileNoSiteXMLSite 
B) testFilePackageExecutableFeatureSite 
C) testSpaceInURL 
D) testSpaceInHTTPURL 

As I understand, the commit process is normally via patch.txt file created 
using Team->Create Patch in Eclipse. But I am not in a position to create such 
a patch.txt file as this patch include jar files. Hence, I am submitting the 
patch as "data.zip". This patch can be applied on HEAD.

The data.zip has the following changes:

1.feature.xml in  data\ExecutableFeaturePackagedSite\data\features\feature3
2.feature.xml in   data\ExecutableFeaturePackagedSite\data2\features\feature3

3.helpFeature.jar in  data\ExecutableFeaturePackagedSite\data\features\
4.org.eclipse.pde.feature_1.0.0.jar in 
data\ExecutableFeaturePackagedSite\data\features\

5.helpFeature.jar in data\Site with space\features space\
6.space feature.jar in data\Site with space\features space\

7.feature.xml in dta\Site with space\install\features space\feature3\

8.helpFeature.jar in webserver\Site with space\features space
9.space feature.jar in webserver\Site with space\features space
thanks, I will review the patch and release it into the repository.

fixed as per provided changes.
Please verify it in the next build and mark the bug as Verified if it works, 
as I cannot test on hp. Thanks!

Though I could see the fixes in the CVS repository, our fixes did not find a 
place in the latest Eclipse 3.0.1 release ie., 200409161125 build. 

Should we wait until next build?

The fix was released into 3.1 milestone 2.
Note that this is a test case fix, not a fix to the eclipse code, so the 3.0 
code should work just as fine.
*** Bug 71145 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

(In reply to comment #9)
> The fix was released into 3.1 milestone 2.
> Note that this is a test case fix, not a fix to the eclipse code, so the 3.0 
> code should work just as fine.

Dorian,
   I could not find the patch in Eclipse 3.0.2 bits(build Id 20050216....)? Am 
I missing something? Thanks !
As per comment #9, it is not in 3.0.2 but in 3.1 milestone 2.
